processed_hadiths.english_translation: [Section header: Nasr ibn Dahr al-Aslami may Allah be pleased with him]

Narrated by Nasr: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said to Amir ibn al-Akwa' during the journey to Khaybar: "Come down with us, O son of al-Akwa', and recite poetry for us." So he came forward chanting verses with the Messenger of Allah ﷺ, saying: "If not for the Messenger of Allah we would not have been guided, nor would we have fasted or prayed. Verily, when a people transgress against us, if they desire tribulation we refuse. So send down tranquility upon us and establish our feet if we meet them." The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: "May your Lord have mercy upon you." Umar ibn al-Khattab said: "By Allah, O Messenger of Allah, it is ordained [success]." He was killed on the day of Khaybar as a martyr.

processed_hadiths.english_translation: [Section header: Al-Adra al-Aslami may Allah be pleased with him]

Narrated by Al-Adra al-Aslami: I came one night to guard the Messenger of Allah ﷺ. There was a man with loud recitation. The Messenger of Allah ﷺ came out and I said: O Messenger of Allah, this man is showing off. He replied: Then he died in Madinah, and when they finished preparing his burial shroud they carried his bier. The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: "Be gentle with him, may Allah be kind to him, for he loved Allah and His Messenger." He continued: I was present at his grave, and he said: "Make it spacious, may Allah make it spacious for him." Some of the Companions said: O Messenger of Allah, you grieved for him? He said: "Yes, for he loved Allah and His Messenger."

processed_hadiths.english_translation: [Section header: Mihjan al-Aslami may Allah be pleased with him]

Narrated from Rajah ibn Abi Rajah: Buraidah al-Aslami entered the mosque while Mihjan was at the door of the mosque. Buraidah said: He was one who joked around. 'Why don't you pray as Sukbah prays?' Mihjan replied: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ took my hand and climbed with me on Uhud, then overlooked Madinah and said: 'Woe to the mother of this city! They will abandon it while it is in its best state and most populous condition. The Dajjal will come and find at each gate of its gates an angel unsheathing his sword, so he will not enter it.' Then the Messenger of Allah ﷺ descended while taking my hand, entered the mosque, and there was a man praying. He said: 'Who is this?' I praised him, so he said: 'Be silent, do not let him hear you, for you will destroy him.' Then he came to the door of one of his wives' chambers and withdrew his hand from mine, then said: 'The best of your religion is its easiest, the best of your religion is its easiest.'
